intro: Gibbaeum haagei, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gibbaeum haagei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
